p: Piper nigrum (L.), popularly known as black pepper, is a member of family Piperaceae [ 17, 18]. The genus Piper includes more than 1000 species, but the best known are P. nigrum, Piper longum, and Piper betle [ 19, 20]. The fruits of P. nigrum contain piperine, a compound that has already shown leishmanicidal activity [ 21]. Furthermore, secondary metabolites of this species possess active compounds with insecticidal activity, antibacterial, antifungal, and others [ 20, 22].
